ISSUE.TITLE: _Poll.cshtml suggestion
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: By default the poll-vote-error element is always visible. It is very possible that it would create styling problems. i.e. border, margin, padding etc. As we see in the JS code for the poll, this element becomes visible through fadeIn: $('#block-poll-vote-error-@(Model.Id)').fadeIn("slow").delay(2000).fadeOut("slow"); which of course applies display:block. Knowing this, I think it would be really good idea to use style="display:none" on the HTML element. Source: http://www.nopcommerce.com/boards/t/41282/_pollcshtml-suggestion.aspx P.S. Do not forget about elements that are also visible the same way: .message-error, .field-validation-error, .username-not-available-status, .poll-vote-error, .password-error {
